name: Hub connectivity issues
body: Rollback changes to `__init__.py` to 0.16.0 to fix Hub connectivity issues introduced in newer releases.

name: Fix issue with checksum under specific conditions
Improve hub communication and dup msg handling
body: This release addresses issues with hub connection stability and improves message deduplication.

name: Scene Cleanup
body: Send scene cleanup messages to all devices known to be in the scene

name: Scene Cleanup
body: This release is being released to be consistent with pypi. However, it should not be used. Use release 0.16.5 instead.

name: Check write lock before restarting writer
body: Eliminates irrelevant debug messages

name: Hub general exception handling
body: Improve general exception handling in the Hub version 2

name: Fix Hub reader stopping due to ValueError
body: This fix has the Hub reader restart on general exception errors rather than stopping.

name: Add scene triggering on and off
Produce wheel as part of standard release
body: * Release process amended to produce and upload a `whl` file as well as the `tar.gz`

name: Refreshed dependencies and build improvements
body:
* Fixed identification of 2342 8 and 4 button remote (#125)
* Reconstituted wheel building
* Cleaned up `setup.py` for more reliable operation.
* Miscellaneous dependency refreshing

name: Rename IOLinc sensor to not conflict with other Open/Closed Sensors
body: The IOLinc sensor was named 'openClosedSensor' and conflicted with the Open/Closed Sensor device models 2421 and 2843-222. This renames the sensor to 'ioLincSensor' for clarity.

name: Fix issue with IOLinc [2450]
body: IOLinc sensor was not reading correctly/consistently.

name: Upgrade python release to 3.5.3 or higher and add 3.7 support
body:
This release adopts the new asyncio methods of async and await. It also sets the minimum python release to 3.5.3. 

Additional changes to Hub connectivity to ensure more stable connections for the 2014 Hub.

Small patch updates to KeypadLincs

name: Fix Posix issue with device in upper case
Add Windows support and fix Hub v1
body:
Addresses the following issues:
#98
#79
#20

Connect to hub v1 via sockets on a configurable port. Default port is 9761.
Move from serial.aio to serial_asyncio to provide proper support for sockets and Windows.

name: Significant code cleanup
body: Passing pylint, flake8 and docstring tests

name: Fix issue with dimmable on message when on level is 0
body: Fix an issue when a manual switch change shows an on message (cmd1 = 0x11) and the on level is 0 (cmd2 = 0x00). The on level is actually 255, not 0.

name: Window Coverings and Thermostat
body: Finally supporting thermostat (cat 0x05) and now window coverings too (0x0E).

name: Clean up error, warning and info log messages
Logger naming fix
body: Ensure all loggers have __name__ defined

name: Improve message handling
body:
Clean up message handling including:
- Better NAK handling
- IM ALDB load NAK retries
- msg_info follows message retries
- Device info request in device, not IM

name: KeypadLinc and Hub stability
body:
Added the KeypadLinc device
Significant Hub connectivity improvements

name: Support for binary sensor events (breaking change)
body:
Deduplicate cleanup messages and message retries
Add light and battery groups to the motion sensor
Send group number rather than state name (breaking change)

name: Fix missing aiohttp in requirements
body: Added aiohttp to requirements.txt to ensure proper installation.

name: Support for mini-remote
body:
Support added for mini-remotes with 1, 4 and 8 buttons. 

Does not support changing the mode from toggle on/off vs separate button on/off but it works regardless of mode.

name: Address pre-NAK response from devices
body: If a device has a long list of ALDB links, it may respond with a NAK message indicating the ALDB search was too long. This handles the response correctly and queries the device for status to confirm if the message was sent correctly.

name: Add Hub support
body: Add Insteon Hub support. This has been tested with a 2245-222 and is reasonably comparable to the PLM. Additional error handling is still a work in progress.

name: Add X10 support
body: Adding X10 support

name: Fix issue with device hanging if no message ACK/NAK received
body: Fixes an issue where the IM does not respond with an ACK or a NAK message. The result is the device hangs because it believes the prior message has not been sent.

name: Improve All linking and command line tool
body:
Introducing a command line tool to support All-Link management and basic device testing.  The following capabilities are added:
- connect - Connect to the PLM (First thing you should do. Type 'help connect' to get the options)
- exit: Exit the tool
- help: Display the help information
- list_devices: List all loaded devices
- load_aldb: Load the device All-Link Database (this may take up to 10 min per device)
- on_off_test: Simple On/Off test to confirm things are working
- print_aldb: Print a devices' All-Link Database (must use load_aldb first)
- running_tasks: List tasks running in the background (not real useful)
- set_device: Set the PLM device name (i.e. /dev/ttyUSB0)
- set_log_level: Set the logging level (i for information v for verbose)
- set_workdir: Set the directory to load saved device info from
- start_all_linking: Set the PLM to start All-Linking
- write_aldb: Write a record to a device All-Link database (BE CAREFUL!!!)

name: Fix sensor handling of All-Link Broadcast messages
body:
This update addresses proper handling of All-Link Broadcast messages to the following devices:
* Hidden Door Sensor
* Leak Sensor
* SmokeBridge
* Generic Category 0x10 devices

name: Load devices from saved devices and device overrides before ALDB
body:
Load devices from saved devices and device overrides before ALDB (#55)
Addresses issue #57

name: Build out IPDB
body:
* Build out IPDB and bump version

* Fix incorrect device names

* Restore missing products and update tests

* Fix spelling error

name: Fix issues with on/off outlet, fanlinc and hidden door sensor
body:
Fixed the following issues:
On/Off Outlet bottom outlet not recognizing manual changes
FanLinc off command 
Hidden door sensor recognized at startup

name: Upgraded devices and message handling
body:
Significant upgrade to allow more complex devices to be created and managed. Breaking features introduced which will require rewriting client code that consumes this library.  Please see the tools.py file for examples of how to manage devices.
Improvements:
 Significant improvement to message handling, especially the fixing of a race issue that causes the system to hang
 Wide support for switch and dimmer devices (cat 0x01 and cat 0x02) 
 Additional complex devices added:
    - FanLinc
    - I/O Linc (was there but now a bit cleaner)
    - On/Off outlet both top and bottom outlets controllable
    - Smokebridge (untested)
Known issues:
NO documentation - sorry, this was low on the list but is on the TODO list
Some common devices not included yet for example:
 KeyPadLinc
 Thermostat
If you have a device you want supported added for please submit an Issue.

name: Pre-seeded device support and workaround for pyserial packaging bug
body:
All pyserial releases (.whl install) newer than 3.2.0 appear to contain an erroneous aio.py file which is breaking things.  python-insteonplm now pins to pyserial 3.2.0 specifically until that project has a chance to correct the problem.

Also included @lanrongwen's work to allow pushing devices into activity even if they don't exist in the PLM's IPDB.

name: Slight changes to device public methods
body: I cleaned up some more public methods for use with the hass component.

name: Code cleanup and device category 0x10 support
body: Adds support for category 0x10 devices (like the Hidden Door Sensor) and major code cleanup and public method documentation.

name: Explicit requirement for pyserial and Python 3.4 changes
body:
When I transplanted my insteonplm component to my production Home Assistant box it broke because pyserial was not installed.  I added that as an explicit requirement to the module in setup.py.

There was also a weird bug (presumably because of Python 3.4) that required a change in bytearray handling within the Address class.

name: Works enough for hass with limited devices
body:
Library is stable enough to support lights and switches and binary sensors in Home Assistant.

There's definitely room for cleanup, there's no documentation, and the code structure is a bit unwieldy.  But it works.

name: Non-functional pre-alpha baseline
body: It connects to the PLM and dumps out hex data as it is seen.  Nothing more.
